entry.title: Best Friends Don’t Get Married
entry.summary:
Author: SzilviBereczki22

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,718Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 47

Summary: Buck and Eddie wake up in Las Vegas with matching rings, matching headaches, and absolutely no idea how they ended up married. It was supposed to be just a fun weekend for the National Firefighter Games—not a legally binding mistake.Best friends don’t get married.At least, that’s what they keep telling themselves. But as the lines between friendship and something more blur, the real question becomes: how do you un-marry someone you never stopped wanting?

entry.title: The Letter on the Table
entry.summary:
Author: happinesscomeswithus

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,010Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 28

Summary: After Bobby’s death, Eddie returns to LA for the funeral. Buck’s already living in his house. Christopher’s just glad they’re under the same roof again.But there's a letter from the El Paso Fire Department on the table — and a silence between Buck and Eddie that’s been stretching for years.Eddie’s tried to outrun the truth before. This time, he sits still and finally speaks it out loud. And when he does, Buck is right there — steady, tender, and ready to give him the one thing he’s never allowed himself to have: love.

entry.title: The Story must go on
entry.summary:
Author: Livreeder_2006

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 965Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 2

Summary: Buck was having a hard time with Bobby being gone. He knows everyone lost someone so special to them. But Bobby, his Bobby was gone. The guy who saved his life more times than he can count.He’s not trying to be selfish, he’s trying to be there for everyone just like Bobby told him to do.“There gonna need you. I love you kid.” The last words Bobby ever said to him.He never said I love you back. That kills him day and night.Eddie Diaz was trying to be there for Buck but he made it impossible. Pretending to be ok, saying he’s fine. But Eddie knows buck better then anyone and he can tell but each time he brings it up buck shuts down. He needs to go to the store, or get gas. Just to leave the conversation.Eddie was back in LA for Bobby’s funeral but he hadn’t left yet. Debating whether or not to take the job in El Paso.Eddie grieves in a vastly different way then buck or anyone of his friends. But he’s trying.All he wants is for someone to ask about that night he found out Bobby died, how he got though it. But not even his best friend has asked him how he’s actually doing.——-Or buck and Eddie get into a fight.

entry.title: Never Let Me Go ( A Sinner Like Me)
entry.summary:
Author: colescharms

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 31,609Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 87

Summary: When infamous rockstar Evan “Buck” Buckley gets injured (again), his label hires Army vet-turned-EMT Eddie Diaz to shadow him on tour. Eddie’s job is simple: keep Buck breathing. But nothing about Buck is simple—not his smile, not his secrets, and definitely not the way he starts to feel like home.Eddie’s supposed to keep Buck safe. Buck’s supposed to stay out of trouble. But somewhere between motel parking lots, midnight emergency calls, and songs that sound too much like confessions, lines blur—and hearts get caught in the wreckage.This tour might save Buck’s career. It might ruin Eddie’s life. Or maybe, if they’re lucky, it could be the start of something louder than either of them expected.

entry.title: 911: Star-Crossed
entry.summary:
Author: BOBBYBEGlNS

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,455Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 5

Summary: Do you ever wonder what would've happened between Brad and Bobby if Athena weren't in the picture? And what if Brad and Bobby started off as enemies? Well, here's your answer.Bobby is the new technical advisor for the hit TV show 'Hotshots' starring Brad Torrence. They get off to a rough start and honestly couldn't be further from friends...or could they?Brad is confident and open about who he is, but will Bobby be able to accept this new version of himself?Find out in 911: Star-Crossed!⚠️READER DISCRETION IS ADVISED⚠️THIS WORK IS INTENDED FOR MATURE AUDIENCES ONLY. It contains mature language and scenes.TRIGGER WARNINGS: This work contains detailed sexual encounters between M/M. There are also discussions about suicidal ideation (flashbacks), spouse and children death (not on page), and homophobia/biphobia/internalized homophobia. Your mental health comes first and if any of these topics are triggering to you, please consider skipping this story.***I DO NOT OWN 911 OR ITS CHARACTERS. ANY CHARACTERS AND STORYLINES NOT FROM 911 BELONG TO ME.***

entry.title: playing house
entry.summary:
Author: princebelials

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,101Chapters: 3/6Kudos: 32

Summary: After Maddie and Chimney announced they were finally going on their honeymoon, they needed to figure out one last thing before they could leave for Puerto Rico: who would be taking care of Jee-Yun?Luckily for them, Uncle Buck, joining forces with none other than Uncle Eddie, stepped up to the task for half the couple’s vacation, with the second half becoming Wilson family territory.Looking after a child together was hardly their first rodeo, but could five days of babysitting really be all it took for the two men to realize the true nature of their feelings for each other? Which wouldn’t have been a problem at all if not for one big obstacle.Buck was currently dating Tommy.

entry.title: The Muse I Ain't Refusin'
entry.summary:
Author: polyphemus_curtains

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,219Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 9

Summary: the one where buck worked as a swamp guide in louisiana before he traveled to peruBefore Peru and after the SEALS, there was a point in Buck’s life where he didn’t have much direction. Not that that specific point in his life had direction at all but still. Buck was at the ranch for a month when he met an older man from Louisiana named Leo. He had an accent that no one could really understand and a few missing fingers. He told stories of his time as a swamp guide in the Atchafalaya water basin, including harrowing tales of wrestling alligators and fishing for killer catfish. These tales, of course, caught Buck’s attention.After a few weeks of working with him, Buck decided a change in scene might be necessary. Plus gumbo didn’t sound all that bad.Starting in somewhere around the end of season 3 and the beginning of season 4
